revised_title: Investigating the Nature of Palladium: A Metallic Substance Sold as a New Metal
tldr: The author, Richard Chenevix, investigates the properties and composition of a metallic substance sold as a new metal called Palladium. Through a series of experiments, he discovers that Palladium is actually a combination of Platinum and Mercury, and not a new, simple metal. The specific gravity of this alloy is lower than expected, which raises questions about the accuracy of specific gravity measurements in determining the composition of metals.
